uk.ac.macaulay.util
Class ToleranceWindowsFCmp

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.macaulay.util.AbstractFloatingPointComparison
      uk.ac.macaulay.util.ToleranceWindowsFCmp
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Number>, FloatingPointComparison
public class ToleranceWindowsFCmp
extends AbstractFloatingPointComparison

ToleranceWindowsFcmp Compare floating point numbers using a small factor added to one or other of the operators indicating a floating point error tolerance level, epsilon. The implementation is designed to avoid using subtraction during comparisons to avoid catastrophic cancellation--a risk, e.g. were equality to be tested using Math.abs(a - b) < epsilon. This may be paranoia! For example, most of the reading I have done on catastrophic cancellation are when greater accuracy is required in |a-b| than the floating point precision can supply. The above expression only requires enough accuracy that we can tell whether the difference is less than epsilon. The program TestCatastrophicCancellation tests a million random numbers between 0 and 1, finding that in no case did using Math.abs() give a different answer than that used here. However, rewriting the program to test a wider range of numbers found differences in 12.5% of cases.

Author:
Gary Polhill

Constructor Detail

ToleranceWindowsFCmp

public ToleranceWindowsFCmp()
Constructor using default single and double epsilons. Single precision floating point comparisons are allowed.

ToleranceWindowsFCmp

public ToleranceWindowsFCmp(double epsilon)
Constructor passing in a double precision epsilon that will also be used for single precision comparisons. If the double precision epsilon is more than 0, but cannot be cast to a single precision epsilon greater than 0, then single-precision comparisons will not be allowed.

Parameters:
epsilon -

ToleranceWindowsFCmp

public ToleranceWindowsFCmp(float epsilon)
Constructor passing in a single precision epsilon that will also be used for double precision comparisons.

Parameters:
epsilon -

ToleranceWindowsFCmp

public ToleranceWindowsFCmp(double depsilon,
                            float fepsilon)
Constructor allowing non-default single and double precision epsilons to be used. Both must be non-negative, non-infinite numbers.

Parameters:
depsilon - double precision epsilon
fepsilon - single precision epsilon
